title: Write the Equation in Standard Form
text: It is in standard form as $$\frac{x^2}{25}+\frac{y^2}{36}=1$$.
speech: It is in standard form as  fraction, x squared, over 25,  plus, fraction, y squared, over 36,  is equal to 1 .
pacedSpeech: It is in standard form as   fraction, x squared, over 25,  plus, fraction, y squared, over 36,  is equal to 1

title: Determine Whether the Major Axis is Horizontal or Vertical
text: Since $$25<36$$ and $$9$$ is in the $$y^2$$ term, the major axis is verticle.
speech: Since  25 is less than, 36  and  9  is in the  y squared  term, the major axis is verticle.
pacedSpeech: term, the major axis is verticle.

title: Find the endpoints of the major axis.
text: The vertices will be the y-intercept. Since $$b^2=36$$ then $$b=-6$$ or $$b=6$$. The endpoint of the major axis are $$(0,6)$$, $$(0,-6)$$.
speech: The vertices will be the y-intercept. Since  b squared is equal to 36  then  b, is equal to, negative 6  or  b, is equal to 6 . The endpoint of the major axis are , parentheses 0 comma 6,  , , parentheses, 0 comma negative 6,  .

title: Find the endpoints of the minor axis.
text: The endpoints will be the x-intercepts. Since $$a^2=25$$, then $$a=-5$$ or $$a=5$$. The endpoints of the minor axis are $$(5,0)$$, $$(-5,0)$$.
speech: The endpoints will be the x-intercepts. Since  a squared is equal to 25 , then  a, is equal to, negative 5  or  a, is equal to 5 . The endpoints of the minor axis are , parentheses 5 comma 0,  , , parentheses, negative 5 comma 0,  .

title: Elimination of Choices
text: The graph with y-intercepts $$(0,6)$$, $$(0,-6)$$ and x-intercepts $$(-5,0)$$, $$(5,0)$$ is the answer.\n##figure1.gif##
